Posts.Content: It makes me really sad that soooo much cancer is going on in the world. I wish there was more I could do.
Posts.Title: When will cancer end????

Posts.Content: It's kind of a double-edged sword when someone you love has been suffering with cancer for a while. I know for my step-father I was releived on one hand he was out of pain, that my mother could once again start taking care of herself, but then there's the devastating void their absence makes. It's very hard and my heart goes out to you. Perhaps you could journal some of your pain? Or take a picture out of your sister and talk to it and try to have more closure. Channel your grief perhaps into something good, raising money for others going through cancer, keeping yourself healthy so no one else in your family has to go through this again, a healing fund in her name to help others in your community with the financial devastation a cancer diagnosis can bring, volunteer to take someone to treatments or bring them lunch during chemo.....I send you healing thoughts. Love, Casey
Posts.Title: the battle lost...now what

Posts.Content: Trust yourself. I went to Burzynski clinic and 2 weeks and $22k later had to have emergency chemotherapy. What would be nice is if we could look at what were doing diet/lifestyle/environmentally to create so much cancer and reverse it. Casey
Posts.Title: Why I Believe The Conspiracy Theory

Posts.Content: Anastrozole inhibits the enzyme aromatase, which is responsible for converting androgens to estrogens. Estrogen feeds certain breast cancers. Fluconazole is an anti-fungal. Something else is going on that they are giving her this I suppose. I would suggest taking a good probiotic along with all of this.I had Stage IV non-hodgkins lymphoma so I don't know a great deal about BC, other than from the ladies in my support group. Â
